page.title: 05CORBRIDGE SCHOOLS
page.content: Education in Corbridge starts with pre-school children.There is a toddler group followed by Play School from age three;these are organised by a committee of mothers and supervised by qualified staff.There is also a private nursery school.These lead on to Corbridge Church of England Aided First School,which now has 151 five to nine year old pupils.Children come to this school from surrounding villages as well as Corbridge itself,but children from Sandhoe go to Beaufront or Hexham.At age nine Corbridge First School children join others from Riding Mill,Whittonstall and Slaley at Corbridge Middle School which has 207 pupils.At age thirteen children travel to Hexham,to the Queen Elizabeth High School.
